result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph S Montalto IV was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant will not request early termination of probation
-----------------------------------

miscConds.notes:
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
-------------------------------------
Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
--------------------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. 
-------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
---------------------------------------

No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent.  Possess no weapons. No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with Vegas Club.
----------------------------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph S Montalto IV

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph S Montalto IV in court.  Attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn in court for Joseph S Montalto IV.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Upon motion of the State count #1, #2, & #4 was dismissed and read-in. Defendant plead guilty to count # 3. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Court gives warning to deportation. Defendant does make statement. Court sentences defendant. Minutes filed.

Defendant Joseph S Montalto IV appeared by phone.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Joseph S Montalto IV in court.  Attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn in court for Joseph S Montalto IV.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph S Montalto IV in court.  Attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn in court for Joseph S Montalto IV. Requesting 30 days. Global offer went out. Court gives 2 weeks, after set for trial. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph S Montalto IV appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Kuehn is not retained on this case yet. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

8:30 AM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph S Montalto IV appeared by video. Attorney Chris Kuehn in court. 
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved by counsel. 
Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made.  
Status set for July 28, 2022 @ 8:30am, 2560
Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Joseph S Montalto IV in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford for the State.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant is on PO hold. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

BOND TO COVER 22GF587 & 22CM37

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH K.B. dob 1-20-1991 or THE VEGAS GENTLEMAN'S CLUB. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-2678 thru 2680
